alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 12 at 3:20PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In New York, Southern Cayuga, Onondaga, Tompkins, Cortland, Tioga and Broome counties. In Pennsylvania, Susquehanna county. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility Tuesday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mix of light snow and rain develops on Monday, eventually transitioning to all snow Monday evening. Periods of snow are expected Monday night and Tuesday, some heavy at times. Lighter snow and areas of blowing snow continues Tuesday night. The highest totals are expected over the higher elevations. The combination of wet snow and gusty winds could cause isolated to scattered power outages.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
